derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: perhaps from Middle Low German, Middle Dutch spiker, related to spoke. The verb dates from the early 17th cent
late Middle English (denoting an ear of corn): from Latin spica (see spica)

entry.def: A spike is a long piece of metal with a sharp point.

example.tran: 顶端装有铁刺的 15 英尺高的墙

example.ex: Yellowing receipts had been impaled on a metal spike.
example.tran: 发黄的收据被穿在一根金属扦上。

entry.def: Any long pointed object can be referred to as a spike .

example.ex: Her hair stood out in spikes.
example.tran: 她的头发一簇簇竖立着。

entry.def: If there is a spike in the price, volume, or amount of something, the price, volume, or amount of it suddenly increases.

example.ex: Although you'd think business would have boomed during the war, there was only a small spike in interest.
example.tran: 人们会认为战争期间生意会很红火，但实际上利息只有小幅上升。

entry.def: Spikes are a pair of sports shoes with pointed pieces of metal attached to the soles. They help runners' feet to grip the ground when they are running.

entry.tran: 偷偷往(饮料中)搀烈性酒(或毒品)
entry.def: If your drink is spiked, someone has added alcohol or drugs to it without telling you.

example.ex: They wondered whether their drinks had been spiked.
example.tran: 他们有些疑惑自己的饮料里是否被偷偷搀了烈性酒。
被偷偷加了镇静剂的饮料

means.word_mean: 1. a transient variation in voltage or current
2. sports equipment consisting of a sharp point on the sole of a shoe worn by athletes;
3. fruiting spike of a cereal plant especially corn
4. (botany) an indeterminate inflorescence bearing sessile flowers on an unbranched axis
5. a sharp rise followed by a sharp decline;

sentences.sentence: "the seismograph showed a sharp spike in response to the temblor"

means.word_mean: 6. a sharp-pointed projection along the top of a fence or wall
7. a long sharp-pointed implement (wood or metal)
8. any holding device consisting of a long sharp-pointed object
2. pierce with a sharp stake or point;
4. bring forth a spike or spikes;

sentences.sentence: "my hyacinths and orchids are spiking now"

auth_sentence.content: Every time oil prices spike so does electricity prices.
auth_sentence.res_content: Every time oil prices spike so does electricity prices.

sentences.en: There is a row of spikes on top of the prison wall to prevent the prisoners escaping.
sentences.cn: 监狱墙头装有一排尖钉, 以防犯人逃跑。

means.word_mean: 使(报纸上的文章等)停止印刷或发行
偷偷地给某人的饮料加入(更多)酒精( 或药物)

sentences.en: It wasn’t until later that I discovered they’d spiked my drink. That’s why I was so ill!
sentences.cn: 直到后来我才发现他们给我的饮料加了东西，难怪我那么难受！

sentences.en: She was jealous of David’s progress in the company, so she spiked his guns by telling the boss that David had a drinking problem.
sentences.cn: 她嫉妒戴维在公司里的进步，所以坏他的事，告诉老板戴维有酗酒的问题。
